title: UDL-Based Science Education Design for Hearing-Impaired Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific concepts and proficiency in fundamental digital device usage
context.additional_context: Classroom environment design addressing diverse learning needs of hearing-impaired students, incorporating visual aids and tactile learning tools

learning_goals: Deaf or hard-of-hearing learners can record experimental results with over 80% accuracy by utilizing visual and tactile materials during the scientific inquiry process.
Learners can explain core science concepts with over 75% accuracy through multiple means of representation designed according to UDL principles.
Learners can perform peer assessments and implement self-regulated learning strategies with over 80% participation through collaborative learning activities.

resources: Visual support software (e.g., caption generation tool)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
